page.title: 10 AYNHO:INTERESTING BUILDINGS
page.content: The {VILLAGE HALL} is opposite the Cartwright Arms. It was built in 1920 with stone from the isolation cottages in Pesthouse Wood. There is a main hall inside with a small room at the back. There are also toilets and a kitchen.It is used for village activities. {FRIARS WELL} is a large house over- looking the Cherwell Valley. It was built as a Dower House for the Cartwrights. {COLLEGE FARM} also overlooks the Cherwell Valley and was a hospice in the 15th. century. Other buildings of interest in the village include THE SCHOOL, THE CARTWRIGHT ARMS, and a number of old cottages such as THE OLD POSTING HOUSE, ORIEL COTTAGE, YEW TREE COTTAGE (all in The Square) and the OLD RAILWAY STATION. Some of the older cottages have evidence of outside stairs.
